workflow.name: Recover no-show appointments with Calendly, Telegram & email alerts
workflow.description:
## Description:
Recover missed opportunities automatically with this n8n automation template.
 The workflow connects with Calendly, identifies no-show meetings, and instantly sends personalized Telegram messages encouraging leads to reschedule. It then notifies the assigned sales representative via email, ensuring timely human follow-up.
Perfect for sales teams, consultants, and customer success managers who want to minimize no-shows, improve conversion rates, and keep pipelines warm ‚Äî all without manual tracking.

## What This Template Does (Step-by-Step)
‚è∞ Runs Every Hour
 Automatically triggers every hour to check your Calendly events for recently missed meetings.
üì• Fetch Active Calendly Appointments
 Retrieves all scheduled events from Calendly using your user URI and event metadata.
üîç Filter for No-Shows (30+ Minutes Past)
 Uses a built-in logic block to detect appointments that ended over 30 minutes ago and were not attended.
üéØ Check Lead Intent
 Processes only leads tagged as ‚ÄúHigh Intent‚Äù in metadata to focus recovery efforts on qualified prospects.
üí¨ Send Telegram Message to Lead
 Sends a personalized message to the lead‚Äôs Telegram ID, including a direct reschedule link and friendly tone from your sales team.
üìß Notify Assigned Sales Rep via Email
 Alerts the relevant rep (from metadata) that the lead missed a meeting and has received an automated Telegram follow-up.
 Includes contact name, status update, and meeting link for manual re-engagement.
üîÅ Continuous Follow-Up Automation
 Repeats hourly, ensuring no missed appointment goes unnoticed ‚Äî even outside working hours.

## Key Features
 ü§ñ Smart detection of no-shows via Calendly API
 üí¨ Telegram message automation with personalization
 üìß Sales rep email alerts with complete context
 üéØ Filters by ‚ÄúHigh Intent‚Äù tag to focus efforts
 ‚öôÔ∏è Easy setup with environment variables and credentials

## Use Cases
 üìû Automatically re-engage missed sales calls
 üìÖ Reduce no-show rates for Calendly meetings
 üí¨ Keep your sales pipeline active and responsive
 üì¢ Notify sales reps in real time about recovery actions

## Required Integrations
- Calendly API ‚Äì to fetch scheduled events and meeting details
- Telegram API ‚Äì to send automated reschedule messages
- SMTP or Gmail ‚Äì to alert the assigned sales representative

## Why Use This Template?
 ‚úÖ Saves hours of manual follow-up effort
 ‚úÖ Boosts reschedule rate for missed meetings
 ‚úÖ Keeps high-value leads warm and engaged
 ‚úÖ Ensures your sales reps never miss a no-show

parameters.text: Hi {{$json.invitee_name}}, we missed you on our call earlier!\nYou can reschedule here: {{$json.uri}}\n‚Äî Team Shoonya
The meeting with {{$json.invitee_name}} appears missed.\nTelegram message sent successfully.\nPlease follow up or reschedule here: {{$json.uri}}
parameters.subject: Missed Appointment: {{$json.invitee_name}}

parameters.content:
## üöÄ WORKFLOW START

**Purpose:** Automatically detect and recover no-show appointments

**Trigger:** Runs every hour to check for missed meetings

**Target:** High-intent leads who didn't attend their scheduled calls

## üìÖ STEP 1: Fetch Appointments

**Action:** Retrieves all active scheduled events from Calendly

**API Endpoint:** Calendly scheduled_events API

**Data Retrieved:** Meeting details, invitee info, attendance status, metadata

## üîç STEP 2: Identify No-Shows

**Logic:** Filters appointments where:
- Meeting ended 30+ minutes ago
- Attendee did NOT show up (attended = false)

**Output:** List of missed appointments only

## üéØ STEP 3: Priority Check

**Condition:** Only proceed if contact has "High Intent" tag

**Why:** Focus recovery efforts on qualified leads

**Source:** Checks metadata.contact_tags field

## üí¨ STEP 4: Customer Outreach

**Action:** Sends friendly reschedule message via Telegram

**Message Includes:**
- Personalized greeting
- Direct reschedule link
- Company signature

**Target:** Lead's Telegram ID from metadata

## üìß STEP 5: Internal Notification

**Action:** Alerts assigned sales rep about the no-show

**Email Contains:**
- Customer name
- Confirmation of Telegram message sent
- Reschedule link for manual follow-up

**Recipient:** Sales rep email from metadata

## ‚öôÔ∏è REQUIRED SETUP

**Environment Variables:**
- CALENDLY_USER_URI

**Credentials:**
- Telegram API (configured)
- SMTP/Gmail (configured)

**Metadata Fields Needed:**
- contact_tags (for "High Intent")
- telegram_id
- rep_email

## üí° KEY BENEFITS

‚úÖ Automatic no-show detection
‚úÖ Immediate customer re-engagement
‚úÖ Sales team stays informed
‚úÖ Prioritizes high-value leads
‚úÖ Reduces manual follow-up work
‚úÖ Increases reschedule rate

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details: The Cron node uses Cron under the hood - a time-based job scheduler in Unix-like computer operating systems. Use this node when you want to trigger workflows periodically, especially in more complex scenarios like "every Tuesday at 9 am" or "Weekdays".

data.details: The Function node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow. Unlike the Function Item node, this node does not operate on incoming node data per-item. Instead, you must iterate over multiple items of incoming data yourself. This can be useful if you're performing data transformation where you want to manipulate the number of items being outputted by the node (i.e. 1 item is inputted in with nested object, 10 items are outputted without any nested objects)

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
